required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Readmission Risk Factors and Heart Failure With Preserved Ejection Fraction
clinical_study.official_title: Readmission Risk Factors and Heart Failure With Preserved Ejection Fraction

brief_summary.textblock: Retrospective review of 492 patient from a small community hospital who did not qualify for participation in the Connect HF study sponsored by DCRI.

detailed_description.textblock: Retrospective review of adults above the age of 18 with a primary diagnosis of HFpEF between August 2017 and March 2018. Subjects had to fall into one of two classifications (NYHA Class II-IV or ACC/AHA Stage B-D) and had a life expectancy greater than 6 months are included. Individuals with a terminal illness other than HF, prior heart transplant or on a transplant list, or current/ planned left ventricular assist device excluded. The primary objective of this study is to identify risk factors for readmission in patients discharged with a diagnosis of HFpEF.

primary_outcome.measure: Readmission Risk Factors and Heart Failure with Preserved Ejection Fraction
primary_outcome.description: Retrospective review to identify risk factors for readmission in patients discharged with a diagnosis of HFpEF.

intervention.description: Retrospective review of study patients excluded from the CONNECT- HF trial who were discharged with a diagnosis of HFpEF between August 1, 2017 and March 1, 2018. Readmission rate at 30 and 90 days along with patient demographics and associated comorbidities were analyzed.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- History of Heart failure diagnosis admitted for treatment
- Ejection fraction < 40% by echocardiogram
Exclusion Criteria:
- Ejection fraction >40% by echocardiogram
- Chronic Kidney disease requiring dialysis
- Terminal illness
- New onset diagnosis of Heart Failure
